block.text: Skip to content Skip to site index U.S. International Canada Español 中文 Today’s Paper New York Times - Top Stories How Law Enforcement Got the Man Suspected of Killing Charlie Kirk F.B.I. leaders touted the immense federal deployment assigned to find the assassin. But their big break came with a single tip — from the suspect’s own family. 6 min read The New York Times This Is the Path the Gunman Took to Get on Campus and Escape Charlie Kirk’s killer spent hours on the campus before climbing onto a roof amid a crowd, and he quickly escaped after the shooting. Berkeley Gives Names of Students and Faculty to Government for Antisemitism Inquiry 2 min read E.P.A. to Stop Collecting Emissions Data From Polluters 3 min read California’s $23 Billion Plan to Restore Federal Cuts to Scientific Research 4 min read Lawsuit Accuses Trump Officials of More Wrongful Deportations 4 min read The Perilous Path to Escape Gaza City Gazans have been forced to flee repeatedly. A visual essay follows the arduous and costly journey. They Turned to ChatGPT for Solutions. But They Are a Nightmare in Heat. Friedman A Plea for President Trump With a Fragile Country on Edge 3 min read Jeb Allen, Peter McHugh, John R. Puri, Benjamin Rothove, Lucy Spence and Ethan Xu ‘I Was Wrong About Charlie Kirk’: Six Conservative Students on His Killing 8 min read Paisley Rekdal This Is What Criticism of the President Cost Me 5 min read Jonathan Alter How Democrats Can Shut Down the Government With Voters on Their Side 5 min read More Opinion In Case You Missed It More News Man Is Fatally Shot in Confrontation With ICE Officers in Chicago Area An ICE officer shot a man who drove his car into the officer during a stop near Chicago, an ICE spokesman said. 3 min read Miles From New York, Another Ex-Governor Seeks a Comeback as Mayor Jim McGreevey and Andrew Cuomo are each competing for mayor against left-leaning opponents in the races to lead cities on opposite banks of the Hudson River. 6 min read Dibyangshu Sarkar/Agence France-Presse — Getty Images A Chaotic Showdown Over Election Integrity in India Opposition parties said a voter verification campaign was part of an influence pattern by Prime Minister Narendra Modi’s government, which dismissed the claims. 6 min read Used E.V.
